sentences.zh: 趙氏之先，與秦共祖。

translations.literal: The Zhao clan's ancestors shared a common ancestor with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The ancestors of the Zhao clan shared a common forebear with the Qin.

sentences.zh: 至中衍，為帝大戊御。

translations.literal: It reached Zhong Yan, who was Di Da Wu's charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: This line reached Zhong Yan, who served as charioteer to Emperor Da Wu.

sentences.zh: 其後世蜚廉有子二人，而命其一子曰惡來，事紂，為周所殺，其後為秦。

translations.literal: Their later generation Fei Lian had two sons. He named one son Wu Lai, who served Zhou. He was killed by Zhou. Their descendants became Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In a later generation, Fei Lian had two sons. He named one E Lai, who served King Zhou. He was executed by Zhou forces. His descendants became the Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 惡來弟曰季勝，其後為趙。

translations.literal: Wu Lai's younger brother was named Ji Sheng. Their descendants became Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai's younger brother was named Ji Sheng. His descendants became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Sheng fathered Meng Zeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Meng Zeng was favored by Zhou Cheng Wang. This was Zhai Gao Lang.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou. He was also known as Zhai Gao Lang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu. Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Lang fathered Heng Fu, who fathered Zao Fu.

sentences.zh: 造父幸於周繆王。

translations.literal: Zao Fu was favored by Zhou Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zao Fu was favored by King Mu of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 造父取驥之乘匹，與桃林盜驪、驊騮、綠耳，獻之繆王。

translations.literal: Zao Fu took a team of Ji horses and, together with Tao Lin, stole Li, Hua Liu, and Lu Er. He offered them to Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zao Fu obtained a team of fine horses and, together with Tao Lin, stole the famed steeds Li, Hua Liu, and Lu Er. He presented them to King Mu.

sentences.zh: 繆王使造父御，西巡狩，見西王母，樂之忘歸。

translations.literal: Mu Wang made Zao Fu drive the chariot on a western inspection. He saw Xi Wang Mu and enjoyed it so much he forgot to return.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu had Zao Fu drive the chariot on a western inspection tour. He met the Queen Mother of the West and enjoyed it so much he forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 而徐偃王反，繆王日馳千里馬，攻徐偃王，大破之。

translations.literal: But Xu Jian Wang rebelled. Mu Wang daily galloped thousand li horses and attacked Xu Jian Wang, greatly defeating him.
translations.idiomatic: But King Xu Jian rebelled. King Mu daily galloped his thousand-li horses and attacked King Xu Jian, greatly defeating him.

sentences.zh: 乃賜造父以趙城，由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: He then granted Zao Fu Zhao city. From this they became the Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: He then granted Zao Fu the city of Zhao. From this they became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自造父已下六世至奄父，曰公仲，周宣王時伐戎，為御。

translations.literal: From Zao Fu down six generations to Yan Fu, called Gong Zhong. In Zhou Xuan Wang's time he attacked the Rong and was charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: From Zao Fu down six generations came Yan Fu, known as Gong Zhong. In King Xuan of Zhou's time he fought the Rong and served as charioteer.

sentences.zh: 及千畝戰，奄父脫宣王。

translations.literal: During the Qian Mu battle, Yan Fu rescued Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: During the battle of Qian Mu, Yan Fu rescued King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 奄父生叔帶。

translations.literal: Yan Fu gave birth to Shu Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Fu fathered Shu Dai.

sentences.zh: 叔帶之時，周幽王無道，去周如晉，事晉文侯，始建趙氏于晉國。

translations.literal: In Shu Dai's time, Zhou You Wang was without the way. He left Zhou and went to Jin, served Jin Wen Hou, and began establishing the Zhao clan in the Jin state.
translations.idiomatic: In Shu Dai's time, King You of Zhou was tyrannical. He left Zhou and went to Jin, served Marquis Wen of Jin, and began establishing the Zhao clan in the Jin state.

sentences.zh: 自叔帶以下，趙宗益興，五世而（生）［至］趙夙。

translations.literal: From Shu Dai below, the Zhao clan increasingly prospered. After five generations it reached Zhao Su.
translations.idiomatic: From Shu Dai onward, the Zhao lineage grew increasingly prominent. After five generations it reached Zhao Su.

sentences.zh: 趙夙，晉獻公之十六年伐霍、魏、耿，而趙夙為將伐霍。

translations.literal: Zhao Su, in Jin Xian Gong's sixteenth year, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng. Zhao Su was the general who attacked Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Su, in Duke Xian of Jin's sixteenth year, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng. Zhao Su was the general who attacked Huo.

sentences.zh: 霍公求奔齊。

translations.literal: Huo gong Qiu fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Huo Qiu fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉大旱，卜之，曰「霍太山為祟」。

translations.literal: Jin great drought, divined it, said 'Huo Tai Shan caused calamity'.
translations.idiomatic: Jin had a great drought. They divined it and said 'Huo Tai Shan caused the calamity.'

sentences.zh: 使趙夙召霍君於齊，復之，以奉霍太山之祀，晉復穰。

translations.literal: They sent Zhao Su to summon the Huo lord from Qi and restore him, to conduct the Huo Tai Shan sacrifices. Jin again became bountiful.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Zhao Su to summon the lord of Huo from Qi and restore him, to conduct the Huo Tai Shan sacrifices. Jin again became bountiful.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公賜趙夙耿。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong granted Zhao Su Geng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Su Geng.

sentences.zh: 夙生共孟，當魯閔公之元年也。

translations.literal: Su gave birth to Gong Meng, during Lu Min Gong's first year.
translations.idiomatic: Su fathered Gong Meng, during the first year of Duke Min of Lu.

sentences.zh: 共孟生趙衰，字子餘。

translations.literal: Gong Meng gave birth to Zhao Shuai, styled Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Meng fathered Zhao Shuai, styled Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙衰卜事晉獻公及諸公子，莫吉；

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai divined serving Jin Xian Gong and various gong zi, none auspicious;
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai divined serving Jin Xian Gong and the various gong zi. None were auspicious;

sentences.zh: 卜事公子重耳，吉，即事重耳。

translations.literal: He divined serving gong zi Chong Er. It was auspicious, so he served Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: He consulted the oracle about serving Prince Chong Er. It was auspicious, so he served Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 重耳以驪姬之亂亡奔翟，趙衰從。

translations.literal: Chong Er, because of the Li Ji chaos, fled to Di. Zhao Shuai followed.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er, because of the Li Ji disturbances, fled to the Di. Zhao Shuai followed him.

sentences.zh: 翟伐廧咎如，得二女，翟以其少女妻重耳，長女妻趙衰而生盾。

translations.literal: Di attacked Mao Jiu Ru and obtained two women. Di married the younger daughter to Chong Er and the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai, who gave birth to Dun.
translations.idiomatic: The Di attacked Mao Jiu Ru and obtained two women. The Di married the younger daughter to Chong Er and the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai, who gave birth to Dun.

sentences.zh: 初，重耳在晉時，趙衰妻亦生趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊。

translations.literal: Initially, when Chong Er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Ying Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, when Chong Er was still in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Ying Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙衰從重耳出亡，凡十九年，得反國。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai followed Chong Er in his flight abroad. Altogether nineteen years, he obtained return to the country.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai followed Chong Er in exile. Altogether nineteen years, they obtained return to the state.

sentences.zh: 重耳為晉文公，趙衰為原大夫，居原，任國政。

translations.literal: Chong Er became Jin Wen Gong. Zhao Shuai became the Yuan grandee, resided at Yuan, and managed the state's governance.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er became Duke Wen of Jin. Zhao Shuai became grandee of Yuan, resided at Yuan, and managed state affairs.

sentences.zh: 文公所以反國及霸，多趙衰計策，語在晉事中。

translations.literal: The reason Wen Gong returned to the country and achieved hegemony was largely due to Zhao Shuai's strategies. This is spoken of in the Jin affairs.
translations.idiomatic: The reason Duke Wen was able to return to the state and achieve hegemony was largely due to Zhao Shuai's strategies. This is recounted in the Jin annals.

sentences.zh: 趙衰既反晉，晉之妻固要迎翟妻，而以其子盾為適嗣，晉妻三子皆下事之。

translations.literal: After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, his Jin wife firmly demanded that the Di wife be welcomed, and made her son Dun the proper heir. The Jin wife's three sons all served below him.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, his Jin wife firmly insisted on welcoming the Di wife, and established her son Dun as the proper heir. The Jin wife's three sons all served below him.

sentences.zh: 晉襄公之六年，而趙衰卒，謚為成季。

translations.literal: In Jin Xiang Gong's sixth year, Zhao Shuai died with the posthumous name Cheng Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang of Jin's sixth year, Zhao Shuai died and was given the posthumous name Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 趙盾代成季任國政二年而晉襄公卒，太子夷皋年少。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji and managed state governance for two years, then Jin Xiang Gong died. The crown prince Yi Gao was young.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun succeeded Cheng Ji and managed state affairs for two years. Then Duke Xiang of Jin died. The crown prince Yi Gao was young.

sentences.zh: 盾為國多難，欲立襄公弟雍。

translations.literal: Dun, because the state had many difficulties, desired to establish Xiang Gong's younger brother Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Because the state had many difficulties, Dun desired to establish Yong, Duke Xiang's younger brother.

sentences.zh: 雍時在秦，使使迎之。

translations.literal: Yong was at that time in Qin. He sent an envoy to welcome him.
translations.idiomatic: Yong was then in Qin. They sent an envoy to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 太子母日夜啼泣，頓首謂趙盾曰：「先君何罪，釋其適子而更求君？」

translations.literal: Crown prince mother day night wept, kowtowed told Zhao Dun said: 'Former lord what crime, released his proper son moreover seek lord?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's mother wept day and night and kowtowed, telling Zhao Dun: 'What crime did the former lord commit? You release his proper son and moreover seek a lord?'

sentences.zh: 趙盾患之，恐其宗與大夫襲誅之，乃遂立太子，是為靈公，發兵距所迎襄公弟於秦者。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun worried about it and feared his clan and grandees would raid and execute him. He then established the crown prince as Ling Gong and mobilized troops to block those welcoming Xiang Gong's younger brother from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun was worried and feared that his clan and the ministers would attack and execute him. He then established the crown prince as Duke Ling and mobilized troops to block those welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin.

sentences.zh: 靈公既立，趙盾益專國政。

translations.literal: After Ling Gong was established, Zhao Dun moreover monopolized the state's governance.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Ling was established, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized the state's governance.

sentences.zh: 靈公立十四年，益驕。

translations.literal: Ling Gong was established for fourteen years and became moreover arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling reigned for fourteen years and became increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 趙盾驟諫，靈公弗聽。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun urgently admonished, but Ling Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun urgently admonished him, but Duke Ling would not listen.

sentences.zh: 及食熊蹯，胹不熟，殺宰人，持其尸出，趙盾見之。

translations.literal: When he ate bear paw that was not properly stewed, he killed the cook and held his corpse out. Zhao Dun saw it.
translations.idiomatic: When eating bear's paw that was not properly cooked, he killed the cook and had his corpse carried out. Zhao Dun saw it.

sentences.zh: 靈公由此懼，欲殺盾。

translations.literal: Ling Gong from this became fearful and desired to kill Dun.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling became fearful as a result and wanted to kill Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾素仁愛人，嘗所食桑下餓人反捍救盾，盾以得亡。

translations.literal: Dun was usually benevolent and loved people. Once, a hungry person he had fed under the mulberry tree instead defended and saved Dun. Thus Dun obtained flight.
translations.idiomatic: Dun was usually benevolent and loved people. Once, a hungry man he had fed under the mulberry tree instead defended and saved Dun, allowing him to escape.

sentences.zh: 未出境，而趙穿弒靈公而立襄公弟黑臀，是為成公。

translations.literal: Before he went out of the border, Zhao Chuan assassinated Ling Gong and established Xiang Gong's younger brother Hei Tun. This was Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Before he could leave the border, Zhao Chuan assassinated Duke Ling and established Hei Tun, Duke Xiang's younger brother. This was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 趙盾復反，任國政。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun again returned and managed the state's governance.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun returned again and managed the state's governance.

sentences.zh: 君子譏盾「為正卿，亡不出境，反不討賊」，故太史書曰「趙盾弒其君」。

translations.literal: Jun zi criticized Dun 'as chief minister, fled not out border, returned not punished traitor', therefore Tai Shi wrote said 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord'.
translations.idiomatic: The jun zi criticized Dun: 'As chief minister, he fled but did not go out of the border, returned but did not punish the traitor.' Therefore the Tai Shi wrote: 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord.'

sentences.zh: 晉景公時而趙盾卒，謚為宣孟，子朔嗣。

translations.literal: During Jin Jing Gong's time, Zhao Dun died with the posthumous name Xuan Meng. His son Shuo inherited.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke Jing of Jin's reign, Zhao Dun died and was given the posthumous name Xuan Meng. His son Shuo succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 趙朔，晉景公之三年，朔為晉將下軍救鄭，與楚莊王戰河上。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo, in Jin Jing Gong's third year, Shuo as Jin's lower army general saved Zheng and battled with Chu Zhuang Wang on the river.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo, in Duke Jing of Jin's third year, served as Jin's lower army general to save Zheng, and battled with King Zhuang of Chu on the river.

sentences.zh: 朔娶晉成公姊為夫人。

translations.literal: Shuo took Jin Cheng Gong's elder sister as his lady.
translations.idiomatic: Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as his wife.

sentences.zh: 晉景公之三年，大夫屠岸賈欲誅趙氏。

translations.literal: In Jin Jing Gong's third year, grandee Tu An Jia desired to execute the Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Jing of Jin's third year, the grandee Tu An Jia desired to execute the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 初，趙盾在時，夢見叔帶持要而哭，甚悲；

translations.literal: Initially, Zhao Dun in time, dreamed saw Shu Dai held waist cried, very sad;
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, he dreamed he saw Shu Dai holding his waist and crying, very sad;

sentences.zh: 已而笑，拊手且歌。

translations.literal: Then he laughed, clapped his hands, and moreover sang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he laughed, clapped his hands, and sang.

sentences.zh: 盾卜之，兆絕而後好。

translations.literal: Dun divined it. The omen was broken but then good.
translations.idiomatic: Dun consulted the oracle about it. The omen was broken but then became favorable.

sentences.zh: 趙史援占之，曰：「此夢甚惡，非君之身，乃君之子，然亦君之咎。

translations.literal: Zhao Shi Yuan interpreted it, said: 'This dream very bad, not lord body, but lord son, however also lord guilt.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shi Yuan interpreted it: 'This dream is very bad. It is not the lord's body, but the lord's son. However, it is also the lord's guilt.

sentences.zh: 至孫，趙將世益衰。」

translations.literal: To grandson, Zhao will generations moreover decline.'
translations.idiomatic: To the grandson, the Zhao will moreover decline through the generations.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈者，始有寵於靈公，及至於景公而賈為司寇，將作難，乃治靈公之賊以致趙盾，遍告諸將曰：「盾雖不知，猶為賊首。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia, began had favor with Ling Gong, when arrived Jing Gong Jia became Si Kou, about to make difficulty, then punished Ling Gong traitor to implicate Zhao Dun, broadly told various generals said: 'Dun though not know, still is traitor head.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia began having favor with Ling Gong. When it came to Jing Gong, Jia became Si Kou. He was about to make difficulty, so he punished Ling Gong's traitor to implicate Zhao Dun. He broadly told the various generals: 'Though Dun did not know, he is still the traitor's head.

sentences.zh: 以臣弒君，子孫在朝，何以懲罪？

translations.literal: With minister assassinated lord, descendants in court, how punish crime?
translations.idiomatic: A minister assassinated his lord. His descendants are in court. How to punish the crime?

sentences.zh: 請誅之。」

translations.literal: Request execute them.'
translations.idiomatic: Request to execute them.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥曰：「靈公遇賊，趙盾在外，吾先君以為無罪，故不誅。

translations.literal: Han Jue said: 'Ling Gong met traitor, Zhao Dun outside, my former lord considered innocent, therefore not executed.
translations.idiomatic: Han Jue said: 'Ling Gong met the traitor. Zhao Dun was outside. My former lord considered him innocent, therefore did not execute him.

sentences.zh: 今諸君將誅其後，是非先君之意而今妄誅。

translations.literal: Now the various lords are about to execute his descendants. This is not the former lord's intention and moreover now recklessly execute.
translations.idiomatic: Now you lords are about to execute his descendants. This is not the former lord's intention and moreover now recklessly execute.

sentences.zh: 妄誅謂之亂。

translations.literal: Reckless execution is called chaos.
translations.idiomatic: Reckless execution is called rebellion.

sentences.zh: 臣有大事而君不聞，是無君也。」

translations.literal: Minister has great matter but lord not hear, this is without lord.'
translations.idiomatic: A minister has great matters but the lord does not hear. This is without a lord.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈不聽。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia would not listen.

sentences.zh: 韓厥告趙朔趣亡。

translations.literal: Han Jue told Zhao Shuo to hurry and flee.
translations.idiomatic: Han Jue told Zhao Shuo to hurry and flee.

sentences.zh: 朔不肯，曰：「子必不絕趙祀，朔死不恨。」

translations.literal: Shuo not willing, said: 'You must not cut Zhao sacrifices, Shuo die not regret.'
translations.idiomatic: Shuo was not willing: 'You must not cut off the Zhao sacrifices. Shuo will die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥許諾，稱疾不出。

translations.literal: Han Jue permitted and agreed. He claimed illness and did not go out.
translations.idiomatic: Han Jue agreed. He claimed illness and did not go out.

sentences.zh: 賈不請而擅與諸將攻趙氏於下宮，殺趙朔、趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊，皆滅其族。

translations.literal: Jia did not request but arbitrarily with the various generals attacked the Zhao clan at the lower palace. He killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Ying Qi. He extinguished all their clans.
translations.idiomatic: Jia did not ask permission but arbitrarily joined with the various generals to attack the Zhao clan at the lower palace. He killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Ying Qi. He extinguished all their clans.

sentences.zh: 趙朔妻成公姊，有遺腹，走公宮匿。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo's wife, Cheng Gong's elder sister, had a posthumous child. She fled and hid in the gong palace.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's wife, Duke Cheng's elder sister, was pregnant with his posthumous child. She fled and hid in the palace.

sentences.zh: 趙朔客曰公孫杵臼，杵臼謂朔友人程嬰曰：「胡不死？」

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo guest named Gong Sun Chu Jiu, Chu Jiu told Shuo friend Cheng Ying said: 'Why not die?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's guest was named Gong Sun Chu Jiu. Chu Jiu told Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「朔之婦有遺腹，若幸而男，吾奉之；

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo wife has posthumous child, if fortunately male, I support him;
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has a posthumous child. If fortunately it is male, I will support him;

sentences.zh: 即女也，吾徐死耳。」

translations.literal: If female, I slowly die.'
translations.idiomatic: If female, I will slowly die.'

sentences.zh: 居無何，而朔婦免身，生男。

translations.literal: After not long, Shuo's wife gave birth to a male.
translations.idiomatic: Before long, Shuo's wife gave birth to a male child.

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈聞之，索於宮中。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia heard it and searched in the palace.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia heard of it and searched in the palace.

sentences.zh: 夫人置兒叱罅祝曰：「趙宗滅乎，若號；

translations.literal: Lady placed child scolded crevice diviner said: 'Zhao clan extinguished? If cry;
translations.idiomatic: The lady placed the child and scolded the crevice diviner: 'Is the Zhao clan extinguished? If so, cry;

sentences.zh: 即不滅，若無聲。」

translations.literal: If not extinguished, if without sound.'
translations.idiomatic: If not extinguished, be without sound.'

sentences.zh: 及索，兒竟無聲。

translations.literal: When searched, the child was actually without sound.
translations.idiomatic: When they searched, the child was miraculously silent.

sentences.zh: 已脫，程嬰謂公孫杵臼曰：「今一索不得，後必且復索之，柰何？」

translations.literal: Already escaped, Cheng Ying told Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Now one search not obtain, later certainly moreover again search it, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Having already escaped, Cheng Ying told Gong Sun Chu Jiu: 'Now one search did not obtain it. Later they will certainly search again. What to do?'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「立孤與死孰難？」

translations.literal: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Establish orphan and die which difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Establishing an orphan and dying - which is more difficult?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「死易，立孤難耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Die easy, establish orphan difficult.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said: 'Dying is easy. Establishing an orphan is difficult.'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「趙氏先君遇子厚，子彊為其難者，吾為其易者，請先死。」

translations.literal: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Zhao clan former lord treated you generously, you strong do the difficult one, I do the easy one, request first die.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'The Zhao clan's former lord treated you generously. You be strong and do the difficult one. I will do the easy one. I request to die first.'

sentences.zh: 乃二人謀取他人嬰兒負之，衣以文葆，匿山中。

translations.literal: Then the two people plotted to take another's infant and carry it. They clothed it with an embroidered cover and hid it in the mountains.
translations.idiomatic: So the two plotted to take someone else's infant and carry it away. They wrapped it in an embroidered blanket and hid it in the mountains.

translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'During the lord's illness, the minister was at the Di's side.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「然，有之。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Yes, had it.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Yes, I had it.

sentences.zh: 子之見我，我何為？」

translations.literal: You saw me, I what for?'
translations.idiomatic: You saw me. What was I doing?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「帝令主君射熊與羆，皆死。」

translations.literal: Blocked road said: 'Di commanded lord shoot bear and pi, all died.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'The Di commanded the lord to shoot the bear and pi. They all died.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「是，且何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Yes, moreover what?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Yes. Moreover what?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「晉國且有大難，主君首之。

translations.literal: Blocked road said: 'Jin state moreover has great difficulty, lord heads it.
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'Jin state will moreover have great difficulty. The lord heads it.

sentences.zh: 帝令主君滅二卿，夫熊與羆皆其祖也。」

translations.literal: Di commanded lord extinguish two ministers, indeed bear and pi all their ancestors.'
translations.idiomatic: The Di commanded the lord to extinguish two ministers. Indeed the bear and pi are all their ancestors.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「帝賜我二笥皆有副，何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Di granted me two baskets all had pairs, what?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'The Di granted me two baskets that all had pairs. What does this mean?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「主君之子將克二國於翟，皆子姓也。」

translations.literal: Blocked road said: 'Lord son will conquer two states at Di, all Zi surname.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'The lord's son will conquer two states at Di. They are all Zi surname.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「吾見兒在帝側，帝屬我一翟犬，曰『及而子之長以賜之』。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'I saw child at Di side, Di entrusted me Di dog, said 'when your son grown grant it to him'.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'I saw a child at the Di's side. The Di entrusted me with a Di dog, saying 'when your son is grown, grant it to him.'

sentences.zh: 夫兒何謂以賜翟犬？」

translations.literal: Indeed child what called grant Di dog?'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, what does the child mean by granting it to the Di dog?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「兒，主君之子也。

translations.literal: Blocked road said: 'Child, lord son.
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'The child is the lord's son.

sentences.zh: 翟犬者，代之先也。

translations.literal: The Di dog is Dai's ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: The Di dog is the ancestor of Dai.

sentences.zh: 主君之子且必有代。

translations.literal: The lord's son will moreover certainly have Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Your lord's son will certainly have Dai as his fief.

sentences.zh: 及主君之後嗣，且有革政而胡服，并二國於翟。」

translations.literal: Reach lord descendants, moreover have change governance Hu clothing, unite two states at Di.'
translations.idiomatic: It will reach the lord's descendants. They will moreover have changed governance and worn Hu clothing, uniting two states at Di.'

sentences.zh: 簡子問其姓而延之以官。

translations.literal: Jian Zi asked his surname and invited him with an office.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi asked his surname and offered him an official position.

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「臣野人，致帝命耳。」

translations.literal: Blocked road said: 'Minister rustic, conveyed Di command only.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said: 'The minister is a rustic. He only conveyed the Di's command.'

sentences.zh: 遂不見。

translations.literal: He was then not seen.
translations.idiomatic: He then disappeared.

sentences.zh: 簡子書藏之府。

translations.literal: Jian Zi wrote it and hid it in the treasury.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi wrote it down and stored it in his treasury.

sentences.zh: 異日，姑布子卿見簡子，簡子遍召諸子相之。

translations.literal: Another day, Gu Bu Zi Qing saw Jian Zi. Jian Zi universally summoned the various sons and had their physiognomy read.
translations.idiomatic: Another day, Gu Bu Zi Qing came to see Jian Zi. Jian Zi summoned all his sons and had their physiognomy read.

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「無為將軍者。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'None become generals.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'None will become generals.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「趙氏其滅乎？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Zhao clan perhaps extinguish?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Will the Zhao clan perhaps be extinguished?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「吾嘗見一子於路，殆君之子也。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'I once saw one son on road, perhaps lord son.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'I once saw a son on the road. He is perhaps the lord's son.'

sentences.zh: 簡子召子毋卹。

translations.literal: Jian Zi summoned his son Wu Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi summoned his son Wu Xu.

sentences.zh: 毋卹至，則子卿起曰：「此真將軍矣！」

translations.literal: Wu Zhi arrived, then Zi Qing rose said: 'This true general!'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi arrived, then Zi Qing rose and said: 'This is the true general!'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「此其母賤，翟婢也，奚道貴哉？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'This his mother lowly, Di concubine, how way noble?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'This one's mother is lowly, a Di concubine. How can he be noble?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「天所授，雖賤必貴。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'Heaven bestowed, though lowly certainly noble.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'Heaven bestowed it. Though lowly, he will certainly be noble.'

sentences.zh: 自是之後，簡子盡召諸子與語，毋卹最賢。

translations.literal: From this time after, Jian Zi completely summoned the various sons and spoke with them. Wu Zhi was the most worthy.
translations.idiomatic: From that time on, Jian Zi summoned all his sons to speak with them. Wu Xu proved the most worthy.

sentences.zh: 簡子乃告諸子曰：「吾藏寶符於常山上，先得者賞。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi then told various sons said: 'I hid treasure tally at Chang Shan top, first obtainer reward.'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi then told the various sons: 'I hid a treasure tally on Chang Shan top. The first to obtain it will be rewarded.'

sentences.zh: 諸子馳之常山上，求，無所得。

translations.literal: The various sons galloped to Chang Shan top and sought it. Nothing was obtained.
translations.idiomatic: The sons galloped to the top of Mount Chang to search for him, but found nothing.

sentences.zh: 毋卹還，曰：「已得符矣。」

translations.literal: Wu Zhi returned, said: 'Already obtained tally.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi returned and said: 'I have already obtained the tally.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「奏之。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Present it.'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Play it.'

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「從常山上臨代，代可取也。」

translations.literal: Wu Zhi said: 'From Chang Shan top overlook Dai, Dai can be taken.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi said: 'From Chang Shan top, overlooking Dai, Dai can be taken.'

sentences.zh: 簡子於是知毋卹果賢，乃廢太子伯魯，而以毋卹為太子。

translations.literal: Jian Zi thereupon knew that Wu Zhi was indeed worthy, so he deposed Crown Prince Bo Lu and made Wu Zhi the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi then knew that Wu Xu was indeed worthy, so he deposed the crown prince Bo Lu and made Wu Xu crown prince instead.

sentences.zh: 後二年，晉定公之十四年，范、中行作亂。

translations.literal: Two years later, in the fourteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Fan and Zhonghang made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, in the fourteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Fan and Zhonghang rose in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 明年春，簡子謂邯鄲大夫午曰：「歸我衛士五百家，吾將置之晉陽。」

translations.literal: Next year spring, Jian Zi told Handan grandee Wu said: 'Return me Wei soldiers five hundred households, I will place them Jin Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: The next year in spring, Jian Zi told the Handan grandee Wu: 'Return to me five hundred households of Wei soldiers. I will place them in Jin Yang.'

sentences.zh: 午許諾，歸而其父兄不聽，倍言。

translations.literal: Wu promised, but when he returned, his father and elder brothers did not listen, and doubled their words.
translations.idiomatic: Wu agreed, but when he returned home his father and brothers would not listen and contradicted him.

sentences.zh: 趙鞅捕午，囚之晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang captured Wu and imprisoned him in Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang captured Wu and imprisoned him in Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 乃告邯鄲人曰：「我私有誅午也，諸君欲誰立？」

translations.literal: Then told Handan people said: 'I privately executed Wu, various lords wish whom establish?'
translations.idiomatic: He then told the Handan people: 'I privately executed Wu. Whom do the various lords wish to establish?'

sentences.zh: 遂殺午。

translations.literal: He then killed Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He then executed Wu.

sentences.zh: 趙稷、涉賓以邯鄲反。

translations.literal: Zhao Ji and She Bin rebelled with Handan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ji and She Bin rebelled with Handan.

sentences.zh: 晉君使籍秦圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: The Jin lord sent Ji Qin to surround Handan.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin sent Ji Qin to besiege Handan.

sentences.zh: 荀寅、范吉射與午善，不肯助秦而謀作亂，董安于知之。

translations.literal: Xun Yin and Fan Ji She were friendly with Wu. They were not willing to assist Qin but plotted rebellion. Dong An Yu knew it.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Yin and Fan Ji She were friendly with Wu. They refused to help Qin and instead plotted rebellion. Dong An Yu learned of this.

sentences.zh: 十月，范、中行氏伐趙鞅，鞅奔晉陽，晉人圍之。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, the Fan and Zhonghang clans attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled to Jin Yang, and the Jin people surrounded it.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, the Fan and Zhonghang clans attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled to Jinyang, and the Jin people besieged him there.

sentences.zh: 范吉射、荀寅仇人魏襄等謀逐荀寅，以梁嬰父代之；

translations.literal: Fan Ji She, Xun Yin enemy Wei Xiang etc. plotted expel Xun Yin, with Liang Ying Fu replace him;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Ji She and Xun Yin's enemies, Wei Xiang and others, plotted to expel Xun Yin and replace him with Liang Ying Fu;

sentences.zh: 逐吉射，以范皋繹代之。

translations.literal: They expelled Ji She and replaced him with Fan Gao Yi.
translations.idiomatic: They drove out Ji She and replaced him with Fan Gao Xi.

sentences.zh: 荀櫟言於晉侯曰：「君命大臣，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Xun Jue spoke to Jin Hou said: 'Lord commands ministers, starts rebellion dies.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Jue spoke to the Jin Hou: 'The lord commands that ministers who start rebellion die.

sentences.zh: 今三臣始亂而獨逐鞅，用刑不均，請皆逐之。」

translations.literal: Now three ministers started rebellion but alone expel Yang, use punishment not even, request all expel them.'
translations.idiomatic: Now three ministers started rebellion but only Yang is expelled. The punishment is uneven. I request all of them be expelled.'

sentences.zh: 十一月，荀櫟、韓不佞、魏哆奉公命以伐范、中行氏，不克。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Xun Jue, Han Bu Ning, and Wei Duo, following the duke's command, attacked the Fan and Zhonghang clans but were not victorious.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Xun Jue, Han Bu Ning, and Wei Duo, following the duke's command, attacked the Fan and Zhonghang clans but failed.

sentences.zh: 范、中行氏反伐公，公擊之，范、中行敗走。

translations.literal: The Fan and Zhonghang clans counter-attacked the duke. The duke struck them, and Fan and Zhonghang were defeated and fled.
translations.idiomatic: The Fan and Zhonghang clans counterattacked the duke. The duke struck at them, and Fan and Zhonghang were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 丁未，二子奔朝歌。

translations.literal: On Ding Wei, the two sons fled to Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: On the dingwei day, the two sons fled to Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏以趙氏為請。

translations.literal: Han and Wei made a request on behalf of the Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei interceded on behalf of the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 十二月辛未，趙鞅入絳，盟于公宮。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month on Xin Wei, Zhao Yang entered Jiang and allied at the duke's palace.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month on the xinwei day, Zhao Yang entered Jiang and made an alliance at the duke's palace.

sentences.zh: 其明年，知伯文子謂趙鞅曰：「范、中行雖信為亂，安于發之，是安于與謀也。

translations.literal: Its next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang said: 'Fan, Zhonghang though truly made rebellion, An Yu exposed it, this An Yu with plotted.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang: 'Although Fan and Zhonghang truly made rebellion, An Yu exposed it. This means An Yu plotted with them.

sentences.zh: 晉國有法，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Jin state has a law: those who start rebellion die.
translations.idiomatic: Jin has a law: those who start rebellion die.

sentences.zh: 夫二子已伏罪而安于獨在。」

translations.literal: Indeed two sons already submitted to punishment but An Yu alone remains.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed the two sons have already submitted to punishment, but An Yu alone remains.'

sentences.zh: 趙鞅患之。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang worried about it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang was troubled by this.

sentences.zh: 安于曰：「臣死，趙氏定，晉國寧，吾死晚矣。」

translations.literal: An Yu said: 'Minister dies, Zhao clan settles, Jin state pacifies, my death late.'
translations.idiomatic: An Yu said: 'If the minister dies, the Zhao clan will settle and Jin state will be pacified. My death comes late.'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: He then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He then took his own life.

sentences.zh: 趙氏以告知伯，然後趙氏寧。

translations.literal: The Zhao clan informed Zhi Bo, and then the Zhao clan was pacified.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao clan informed Zhi Bo, and then the Zhao clan was pacified.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞趙簡子不請晉君而執邯鄲午，保晉陽，故書春秋曰「趙鞅以晉陽畔」。

translations.literal: Kong Zi heard Zhao Jian Zi not requested Jin lord but executed Handan Wu, protected Jin Yang, therefore wrote Spring Autumns said 'Zhao Yang with Jin Yang rebelled'.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi heard that Zhao Jian Zi executed Handan Wu without requesting the Jin lord and protected Jin Yang. Therefore he wrote in the Spring and Autumn Annals: 'Zhao Yang rebelled with Jin Yang.'

sentences.zh: 趙簡子有臣曰周舍，好直諫。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi had a minister called Zhou She who liked direct admonition.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Jian Zi had a minister named Zhou She who was fond of direct admonition.

sentences.zh: 周舍死，簡子每聽朝，常不悅，大夫請罪。

translations.literal: When Zhou She died, Jian Zi, whenever he listened to court, was often displeased. The grandees requested punishment.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhou She died, Jian Zi, whenever he attended court, was often displeased. The grandees begged for punishment.

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「大夫無罪。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Grandees no crime.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'The grandees have no crime.

sentences.zh: 吾聞千羊之皮不如一狐之腋。

translations.literal: I have heard that a thousand sheep skins do not equal one fox armpit.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that a thousand sheep skins do not equal one fox's armpit.

sentences.zh: 諸大夫朝，徒聞唯唯，不聞周捨之鄂鄂，是以憂也。」

translations.literal: Various grandees court, only heard wei wei, not heard Zhou She e e, this why worry.'
translations.idiomatic: The various grandees in court, I only hear wei wei agreement, not Zhou She's e e admonition. This is why I worry.'

sentences.zh: 簡子由此能附趙邑而懷晉人。

translations.literal: From this, Jian Zi could attach Zhao cities and embrace the Jin people.
translations.idiomatic: From this, Jian Zi was able to unite the Zhao cities and win over the Jin people.

sentences.zh: 晉定公十八年，趙簡子圍范、中行于朝歌，中行文子奔邯鄲。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Zhao Jian Zi surrounded Fan and Zhonghang at Zhao Ge. Zhonghang Wen Zi fled to Handan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Zhao Jian Zi besieged Fan and Zhonghang at Zhaoge. Zhonghang Wen Zi fled to Handan.

sentences.zh: 明年，衛靈公卒。

translations.literal: The next year, Duke Ling of Wei died.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Duke Ling of Wei died.

sentences.zh: 簡子與陽虎送衛太子蒯聵于衛，衛不內，居戚。

translations.literal: Jian Zi and Yang Hu sent Wei's Crown Prince Kuai Kui to Wei. Wei did not admit him, so he resided in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi and Yang Hu escorted Wei's Crown Prince Kuai Kui back to Wei. Wei refused to admit him, so he resided in Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉定公二十一年，簡子拔邯鄲，中行文子奔柏人。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year of Duke Ding of Jin, Jian Zi captured Handan. Zhonghang Wen Zi fled to Bai Ren.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year of Duke Ding of Jin, Jian Zi captured Handan. Zhonghang Wen Zi fled to Bai Ren.

sentences.zh: 簡子又圍柏人，中行文子、范昭子遂奔齊。

translations.literal: Jian Zi again surrounded Bai Ren. Zhonghang Wen Zi and Fan Zhao Zi then fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi again besieged Bai Ren. Zhonghang Wen Zi and Fan Zhao Zi then fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙竟有邯鄲、柏人。

translations.literal: Zhao finally had Handan and Bai Ren.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao finally possessed Handan and Bai Ren.

sentences.zh: 范、中行餘邑入于晉。

translations.literal: The remaining cities of Fan and Zhonghang entered Jin.

sentences.zh: 趙名晉卿，實專晉權，奉邑侔於諸侯。

translations.literal: Zhao was nominally a Jin minister, but actually monopolized Jin's authority. His fief cities equaled those of feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 晉定公三十年，定公與吳王夫差爭長於黃池，趙簡子從晉定公，卒長吳。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Ding Gong contended for precedence with King Fu Chai of Wu at Huang Chi. Zhao Jian Zi followed Jin Ding Gong and finally gave precedence to Wu.

sentences.zh: 定公三十七年卒，而簡子除三年之喪，期而已。

translations.literal: Ding Gong died in the thirty-seventh year. Jian Zi removed the three-year mourning period and made it only one year.

sentences.zh: 是歲，越王句踐滅吳。

translations.literal: This year, King Gou Jian of Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十一年，知伯伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year of Duke Chu of Jin, Zhi Bo attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子疾，使太子毋卹將而圍鄭。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi was ill and sent Crown Prince Wu Zhi to lead the army and surround Zheng.

sentences.zh: 知伯醉，以酒灌擊毋卹。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo was drunk and poured wine while striking Wu Zhi.

sentences.zh: 毋卹群臣請死之。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi's group of ministers requested to die for him.

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「君所以置毋卹，為能忍。」

translations.literal: Wu Zhi said: 'Lord reason placed Wu Zhi, for able endure.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi said: 'The reason the lord placed Wu Zhi was for his ability to endure.'

sentences.zh: 然亦慍知伯。

translations.literal: Yet he also resented Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 知伯歸，因謂簡子，使廢毋卹，簡子不聽。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo returned and then told Jian Zi to depose Wu Zhi. Jian Zi did not listen.

sentences.zh: 毋卹由此怨知伯。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi from this resented Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十七年，簡子卒，太子毋卹代立，是為襄子。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year of Duke Chu of Jin, Jian Zi died. Crown Prince Wu Zhi succeeded and was established. This was Xiang Zi.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子元年，越圍吳。

translations.literal: In Zhao Xiang Zi's first year, Yue surrounded Wu.

sentences.zh: 襄子降喪食，使楚隆問吳王。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi reduced his mourning food and sent Chu Long to inquire about the Wu Wang.

sentences.zh: 襄子姊前為代王夫人。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi's elder sister had previously been the wife of the Dai Wang.

sentences.zh: 簡子既葬，未除服，北登夏屋，請代王。

translations.literal: After Jian Zi was buried but before mourning garments were removed, he ascended Xia Wu in the north and invited the Dai Wang.

sentences.zh: 使廚人操銅枓以食代王及從者，行斟，陰令宰人各以枓擊殺代王及從官，遂興兵平代地。

translations.literal: He sent cooks holding bronze dou vessels to feed the Dai Wang and his followers. As they went pouring wine, he secretly commanded the cooks to each strike and kill the Dai Wang and his following officials with the dou vessels. He then raised troops and pacified the Dai lands.

sentences.zh: 其姊聞之，泣而呼天，摩笄自殺。

translations.literal: His elder sister heard it, wept while calling to heaven, rubbed her hairpin, and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 代人憐之，所死地名之為摩笄之山。

translations.literal: The Dai people pitied her. The place where she died was named Mo Ji Mountain.

sentences.zh: 遂以代封伯魯子周為代成君。

translations.literal: He then enfeoffed Bo Lu's son Zhou with Dai as Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 伯魯者，襄子兄，故太子。

translations.literal: Bo Lu was Xiang Zi's elder brother and former crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子蚤死，故封其子。

translations.literal: The crown prince died early, therefore he enfeoffed his son.

sentences.zh: 襄子立四年，知伯與趙、韓、魏盡分其范、中行故地。

translations.literal: In Xiang Zi's fourth year of establishment, Zhi Bo with Zhao, Han, and Wei completely divided the former lands of Fan and Zhonghang.

sentences.zh: 晉出公怒，告齊、魯，欲以伐四卿。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong was angered and informed Qi and Lu, wishing to attack the four ministers.

sentences.zh: 四卿恐，遂共攻出公。

translations.literal: The four ministers feared and then together attacked Chu Gong.

sentences.zh: 出公奔齊，道死。

translations.literal: Chu Gong fled to Qi and died on the road.

sentences.zh: 知伯乃立昭公曾孫驕，是為晉懿公。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo then established Zhao Gong's great-grandson Jiao. This was Jin Yi Gong.

sentences.zh: 知伯益驕。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo became moreover arrogant.

sentences.zh: 請地韓、魏，韓、魏與之。

translations.literal: He requested land from Han and Wei. Han and Wei gave it.

sentences.zh: 請地趙，趙不與，以其圍鄭之辱。

translations.literal: He requested land from Zhao. Zhao did not give it, because of the humiliation at the surrounding of Zheng.

sentences.zh: 知伯怒，遂率韓、魏攻趙。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo was angered and then led Han and Wei to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子懼，乃奔保晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Zi feared and then fled to defend Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 原過從，後，至於王澤，見三人，自帶以上可見，自帶以下不可見。

translations.literal: Yuan Guo followed afterwards. He reached Wang Ze and saw three people. From the belt above they were visible, from the belt below they were invisible.

sentences.zh: 與原過竹二節，莫通。

translations.literal: He gave Yuan Guo two sections of bamboo, not opened.

sentences.zh: 曰：「為我以是遺趙毋卹。」

translations.literal: Said: 'For me with this leave to Zhao Wu Zhi.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'For me, leave this to Zhao Wu Zhi.'

sentences.zh: 原過既至，以告襄子。

translations.literal: When Yuan Guo arrived, he told Xiang Zi.

sentences.zh: 襄子齊三日，親自剖竹，有朱書曰：「趙毋卹，余霍泰山山陽侯天使也。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi fasted three days, personally split bamboo, had vermilion writing said: 'Zhao Wu Zhi, I Huo Tai Shan Shan Yang Hou heavenly envoy.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi fasted for three days and personally split the bamboo. It had vermilion writing that said: 'Zhao Wu Zhi, I am the heavenly envoy of Huo Tai Shan Shan Yang Hou.

sentences.zh: 三月丙戌，余將使女反滅知氏。

translations.literal: On the Bing Xu of the third month, I will make you counter and extinguish the Zhi clan.

sentences.zh: 女亦立我百邑，余將賜女林胡之地。

translations.literal: You also establish a hundred cities for me. I will grant you the lands of Lin Hu.

sentences.zh: 至于後世，且有伉王，赤黑，龍面而鳥噣，鬢麋髭髯，大膺大胸，修下而馮，左袵界乘，奄有河宗，至于休溷諸貉，南伐晉別，北滅黑姑。」

translations.literal: Reach later generations, moreover have strong king, red black, dragon face bird beak, hair deer whiskers beard, big chest big breast, long below support, left collar boundary ride, encompass He Zong, reach Xiu Hun various Hu, south attack Jin separate, north extinguish Hei Gu.'
translations.idiomatic: It will reach later generations. There will moreover be a strong king, red and black, dragon face with bird beak, deer hair whiskers and beard, big chest big breast, long below and supporting, left collar boundary riding, encompassing the He Zong, reaching the various Hu of Xiu Hun, south attacking Jin's separation, north extinguishing Hei Gu.'

sentences.zh: 襄子再拜，受三神之令。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi bowed twice and received the three spirits' command.

sentences.zh: 三國攻晉陽，歲餘，引汾水灌其城，城不浸者三版。

translations.literal: The three states attacked Jin Yang. After more than a year, they led Fen water to flood the city. The city was not submerged by three boards.

sentences.zh: 城中懸釜而炊，易子而食。

translations.literal: In the city, they suspended cauldrons to cook and exchanged children to eat.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆有外心，禮益慢，唯高共不敢失禮。

translations.literal: The group of ministers all had outside hearts. Rites became moreover slow. Only Gao Gong dared not lose rites.

sentences.zh: 襄子懼，乃夜使相張孟同私於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi feared and then at night sent the minister Zhang Meng Tong privately to Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏與合謀，以三月丙戌，三國反滅知氏，共分其地。

translations.literal: Han and Wei joined in the plot. On the Bing Xu of the third month, the three states counter-attacked and extinguished the Zhi clan, together dividing its lands.

sentences.zh: 於是襄子行賞，高共為上。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Zi gave rewards. Gao Gong was the highest.

sentences.zh: 張孟同曰：「晉陽之難，唯共無功。」

translations.literal: Zhang Meng Tong said: 'Jin Yang difficulty, only Gong no merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Meng Tong said: 'In the Jin Yang difficulty, only Gong had no merit.'

sentences.zh: 襄子曰：「方晉陽急，群臣皆懈，惟共不敢失人臣禮，是以先之。」

translations.literal: Xiang Zi said: 'When Jin Yang urgent, group ministers all slack, only Gong dared not lose minister rites, therefore first him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi said: 'When Jin Yang was urgent, the group of ministers were all slack. Only Gong dared not lose minister rites. Therefore he is first.'

sentences.zh: 於是趙北有代，南并知氏，彊於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Thereupon Zhao had Dai in the north and annexed the Zhi clan in the south. It was strong compared to Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 遂祠三神於百邑，使原過主霍泰山祠祀。

translations.literal: He then sacrificed to the three spirits at a hundred cities and sent Yuan Guo to preside over the Huo Tai Shan sacrifice rites.

sentences.zh: 其後娶空同氏，生五子。

translations.literal: Afterwards he married a Kong Tong woman and gave birth to five sons.

sentences.zh: 襄子為伯魯之不立也，不肯立子，且必欲傳位與伯魯子代成君。

translations.literal: Because Bo Lu was not established, Xiang Zi was not willing to establish his own son, and moreover certainly desired to transmit the position to Bo Lu's son, Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 成君先死，乃取代成君子浣立為太子。

translations.literal: Cheng Jun died first. He then replaced him and established Dai Cheng Jun's son Huan as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 襄子立三十三年卒，浣立，是為獻侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi was established for thirty-three years and died. Huan was established. This was Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 獻侯少即位，治中牟。

translations.literal: Xian Hou ascended the position when young and governed Zhong Mou.

sentences.zh: 襄子弟桓子逐獻侯，自立於代，一年卒。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi's younger brother Jian Zi expelled Xian Hou and self-established at Dai. He died after one year.

sentences.zh: 國人曰桓子立非襄子意，乃共殺其子而復迎立獻侯。

translations.literal: The state people said that Jian Zi's establishment was not Xiang Zi's intent. They then together killed his son and again welcomed and established Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 十年，中山武公初立。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Zhongshan Wu Gong was initially established.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城平邑。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, they walled Ping Yi.

sentences.zh: 十五年，獻侯卒，子烈侯籍立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Xian Hou died. His son Lie Hou Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 烈侯元年，魏文侯伐中山，使太子擊守之。

translations.literal: In Lie Hou's first year, Wei Wen Hou attacked Zhongshan and sent Crown Prince Ji to guard it.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏、韓、趙皆相立為諸侯，追尊獻子為獻侯。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Wei, Han, and Zhao all mutually established themselves as feudal lords and posthumously honored Xian Zi as Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 烈侯好音，謂相國公仲連曰：「寡人有愛，可以貴之乎？」

translations.literal: Lie Hou liked music, told chancellor Gong Zhong Lian said: 'I have love, can ennoble it?'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou liked music. He told the chancellor Gong Zhong Lian: 'I have a love. Can I ennoble it?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「富之可，貴之則否。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Enrich it can, ennoble it then no.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'You can enrich it, but ennobling it is not appropriate.'

sentences.zh: 烈侯曰：「然。

translations.literal: Lie Hou said: 'Yes.

sentences.zh: 夫鄭歌者槍、石二人，吾賜之田，人萬畝。」

translations.literal: Indeed Zheng singers Qiang, Shi two people, I grant them fields, each ten thousand mu.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed the Zheng singers Qiang and Shi, two people. I will grant them fields, each ten thousand mu.'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 不與。

translations.literal: He did not give.

sentences.zh: 居一月，烈侯從代來，問歌者田。

translations.literal: After one month, Lie Hou came from Dai and asked about the singers' fields.

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「求，未有可者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Seeking, not yet have suitable.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'Seeking them, not yet have suitable ones.'

sentences.zh: 有頃，烈侯復問。

translations.literal: After a moment, Lie Hou asked again.

sentences.zh: 公仲終不與，乃稱疾不朝。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong finally did not give. He then claimed illness and did not attend court.

sentences.zh: 番吾君自代來，謂公仲曰：「君實好善，而未知所持。

translations.literal: Fan Wu Jun from Dai came, told Gong Zhong said: 'Lord indeed loves goodness, but does not know what to hold.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Wu Jun came from Dai and told Gong Zhong: 'You indeed love goodness, but do not know what to hold.

sentences.zh: 今公仲相趙，於今四年，亦有進士乎？」

translations.literal: Now Gong Zhong chancellor Zhao, to now four years, also have advanced scholars?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Gong Zhong has been chancellor of Zhao for four years. Have you also advanced any scholars?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「未也。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Not yet.'

sentences.zh: 番吾君曰：「牛畜、荀欣、徐越皆可。」

translations.literal: Fan Wu Jun said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, Xu Yue all suitable.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Wu Jun said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, Xu Yue are all suitable.'

sentences.zh: 公仲乃進三人。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong then advanced the three people.

sentences.zh: 及朝，烈侯復問：「歌者田何如？」

translations.literal: When court, Lie Hou again asked: 'Singers fields how?'
translations.idiomatic: At court, Lie Hou again asked: 'How are the singers' fields?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「方使擇其善者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Just sent choose their good ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'I just sent people to choose good ones for them.'

sentences.zh: 牛畜侍烈侯以仁義，約以王道，烈侯逌然。

translations.literal: Niu Xu served Lie Hou with benevolence and righteousness, restrained him with the way of the king. Lie Hou became enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明日，荀欣侍，以選練舉賢，任官使能。

translations.literal: The next day, Xun Xin served, with selecting and training to raise the worthy, appointing officials and employing the able.

sentences.zh: 明日，徐越侍，以節財儉用，察度功德。

translations.literal: The next day, Xu Yue served, with restraining wealth and frugal use, examining and measuring merit and virtue.

sentences.zh: 所與無不充，君說。

translations.literal: What was given was nothing but full. The lord was pleased.

sentences.zh: 烈侯使使謂相國曰：「歌者之田且止。」

translations.literal: Lie Hou sent envoy told chancellor said: 'Singers fields moreover stop.'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou sent an envoy to tell the chancellor: 'The singers' fields should moreover stop.'

sentences.zh: 官牛畜為師，荀欣為中尉，徐越為內史，賜相國衣二襲。

translations.literal: He appointed Niu Xu as teacher, Xun Xin as central captain, Xu Yue as inner scribe, and granted the chancellor two sets of clothes.

sentences.zh: 九年，烈侯卒，弟武公立。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Lie Hou died. His younger brother Wu Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 武公十三年卒，趙復立烈侯太子章，是為敬侯。

translations.literal: Wu Gong died in the thirteenth year. Zhao again established Lie Hou's crown prince Zhang. This was Jing Hou.

sentences.zh: 是歲，魏文侯卒。

translations.literal: This year, Wei Wen Hou died.

sentences.zh: 敬侯元年，武公子朝作亂，不克，出奔魏。

translations.literal: In Jing Hou's first year, Wu Gong's son Zhao made rebellion but was not victorious. He went and fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙始都邯鄲。

translations.literal: Zhao began making Handan its capital.

sentences.zh: 二年，敗齊于靈丘。

translations.literal: In the second year, they defeated Qi at Ling Qiu.

sentences.zh: 三年，救魏于廩丘，大敗齊人。

translations.literal: In the third year, they saved Wei at Lin Qiu and greatly defeated the Qi people.

sentences.zh: 四年，魏敗我兔臺。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wei defeated our Tu Tai.

sentences.zh: 筑剛平以侵衛。

translations.literal: They built Gang Ping to invade Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，齊、魏為衛攻趙，取我剛平。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qi and Wei attacked Zhao for Wei and took our Gang Ping.

sentences.zh: 六年，借兵於楚伐魏，取棘蒲。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they borrowed troops from Chu to attack Wei and took Ji Pu.

sentences.zh: 八年，拔魏黃城。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, they captured Wei's Huang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐齊。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊伐燕，趙救燕。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Yan. Zhao saved Yan.

sentences.zh: 十年，與中山戰于房子。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they fought with Zhongshan at Fang Zi.

sentences.zh: 十一年，魏、韓、趙共滅晉，分其地。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wei, Han, and Zhao together extinguished Jin and divided its lands.

sentences.zh: 伐中山，又戰於中人。

translations.literal: They attacked Zhongshan and again fought at Zhong Ren.

sentences.zh: 十二年，敬侯卒，子成侯種立。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Jing Hou died. His son Cheng Hou Zhong was established.

sentences.zh: 成侯元年，公子勝與成侯爭立，為亂。

translations.literal: In Cheng Hou's first year, Prince Sheng contended with Cheng Hou for establishment and made rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二年六月，雨雪。

translations.literal: In the second year, sixth month, it rained snow.

sentences.zh: 三年，太戊午為相。

translations.literal: In the third year, Tai Wu Wu became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 伐衛，取鄉邑七十三。

translations.literal: They attacked Wei and took seventy-three townships.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我藺。

translations.literal: Wei defeated our Lin.

sentences.zh: 四年，與秦戰高安，敗之。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they fought with Qin at Gao An and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐齊于鄄。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, they attacked Qi at Juan.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我懷。

translations.literal: Wei defeated our Huai.

sentences.zh: 攻鄭，敗之，以與韓，韓與我長子。

translations.literal: They attacked Zheng and defeated it. They gave it to Han. Han gave me their eldest son.

sentences.zh: 六年，中山筑長城。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Zhongshan built a long wall.

sentences.zh: 伐魏，敗湪澤，圍魏惠王。

translations.literal: They attacked Wei, were defeated at Tuo Ze, and surrounded Wei Hui Wang.

sentences.zh: 七年，侵齊，至長城。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, they invaded Qi and reached the long wall.

sentences.zh: 與韓攻周。

translations.literal: With Han they attacked Zhou.

sentences.zh: 八年，與韓分周以為兩。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, with Han they divided Zhou into two.

sentences.zh: 九年，與齊戰阿下。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they fought with Qi at A Xia.

sentences.zh: 十年，攻衛，取甄。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they attacked Wei and took Zhen.

sentences.zh: 十一年，秦攻魏，趙救之石阿。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qin attacked Wei. Zhao saved them at Shi E.

sentences.zh: 十二年，秦攻魏少梁，趙救之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Qin attacked Wei's Shao Liang. Zhao saved them.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦獻公使庶長國伐魏少梁，虜其太子、痤。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Qin Xian Gong sent Shu Zhang Guo to attack Wei's Shao Liang and captured their crown prince Yi.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我澮，取皮牢。

translations.literal: Wei defeated our Kui and took Pi Lao.

sentences.zh: 成侯與韓昭侯遇上黨。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou met with Han Zhao Hou at Shang Dang.

sentences.zh: 十四年，與韓攻秦。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, with Han they attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 十五年，助魏攻齊。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they assisted Wei in attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與韓、魏分晉，封晉君以端氏。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, with Han and Wei they divided Jin and enfeoffed the Jin lord with Duan Shi.

sentences.zh: 十七年，成侯與魏惠王遇葛孽。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Cheng Hou met with Wei Hui Wang at Ge Nie.

sentences.zh: 十九年，與齊、宋會平陸，與燕會阿。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, with Qi and Song they met at Ping Lu, with Yan they met at E.

sentences.zh: 二十年，魏獻榮椽，因以為檀臺。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Wei offered rong chuan, and thus made Tan Tai.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，魏圍我邯鄲。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Wei surrounded our Handan.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，魏惠王拔我邯鄲，齊亦敗魏於桂陵。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wei Hui Wang captured our Handan. Qi also defeated Wei at Gui Ling.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，魏歸我邯鄲，與魏盟漳水上。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Wei returned our Handan. They allied with Wei on the Zhang Shui.

sentences.zh: 秦攻我藺。

translations.literal: Qin attacked our Lin.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，成侯卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Cheng Hou died.

sentences.zh: 公子紲太子肅侯爭立，紲敗亡奔韓。

translations.literal: Prince Xi contended with Crown Prince Su Hou for establishment. Xi was defeated and fled to Han.

sentences.zh: 肅侯元年，奪晉君端氏，徙處屯留。

translations.literal: In Su Hou's first year, they seized the Jin lord's Duan Shi and moved him to reside in Tun Liu.

sentences.zh: 二年，與魏惠王遇於陰晉。

translations.literal: In the second year, they met with Wei Hui Wang at Yin Jin.

sentences.zh: 三年，公子范襲邯鄲，不勝而死。

translations.literal: In the third year, Prince Fan raided Handan but was not victorious and died.

sentences.zh: 四年，朝天子。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they courted the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 六年，攻齊，拔高唐。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they attacked Qi and captured Gao Tang.

sentences.zh: 七年，公子刻攻魏首垣。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Prince Ke attacked Wei's Shou Yuan.

sentences.zh: 十一年，秦孝公使商君伐魏，虜其將公子卬。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qin Xiao Gong sent Lord Shang to attack Wei and captured their general Prince Ang.

sentences.zh: 趙伐魏。

translations.literal: Zhao attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 十二年，秦孝公卒，商君死。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Qin Xiao Gong died and Lord Shang died.

sentences.zh: 十五年，起壽陵。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they raised Shou Ling.

sentences.zh: 魏惠王卒。

translations.literal: Wei Hui Wang died.

sentences.zh: 十六年，肅侯游大陵，出於鹿門，大戊午扣馬曰：「耕事方急，一日不作，百日不食。」

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Su Hou toured Da Ling, went out Lu Men, Da Wu Wu grasped horse said: 'Farming matters just urgent, one day not work, hundred days not eat.'
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Su Hou toured Da Ling and went out through Lu Men. Da Wu Wu grasped the horse and said: 'Farming matters are just urgent. One day not working means a hundred days without eating.'

sentences.zh: 肅侯下車謝。

translations.literal: Su Hou descended from his carriage and apologized.

sentences.zh: 十七年，圍魏黃，不克。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, they surrounded Wei's Huang but were not victorious.

sentences.zh: 筑長城。

translations.literal: They built a long wall.

sentences.zh: 十八年，齊、魏伐我，我決河水灌之，兵去。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Qi and Wei attacked us. We breached the river and flooded them. The troops left.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，張儀相秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 趙疵與秦戰，敗，秦殺疵河西，取我藺、離石。

translations.literal: Zhao Ci fought with Qin and was defeated. Qin killed Ci west of the river and took our Lin and Li Shi.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，韓舉與齊、魏戰，死于桑丘。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Han Ju fought with Qi and Wei and died at Sang Qiu.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，肅侯卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Su Hou died.

sentences.zh: 秦、楚、燕、齊、魏出銳師各萬人來會葬。

translations.literal: Qin, Chu, Yan, Qi, and Wei each sent ten thousand sharp troops to assemble for the burial.

sentences.zh: 子武靈王立。

translations.literal: His son Wu Ling Wang was established.

sentences.zh: 武靈王元年，陽文君趙豹相。

translations.literal: In Wu Ling Wang's first year, Yang Wen Jun Zhao Bao became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 梁襄王與太子嗣，韓宣王與太子倉來朝信宮。

translations.literal: Dai chancellor Zhao Gu governed the Hu and brought their troops.

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, he attacked Zhongshan.

translations.literal: Zhao Dan was the right army, Xu Jun the left army, Prince Zhang the middle army. The Wang commanded them together.

sentences.zh: 牛翦將車騎，趙希并將胡、代。

translations.literal: Niu Jian commanded the chariots and cavalry. Zhao Xi together commanded the Hu and Dai.

sentences.zh: 王軍取鄗、石邑、封龍、東垣。

translations.literal: The Wang's army took Hao, Shi Yi, Feng Long, and Dong Yuan.

sentences.zh: 中山獻四邑和，王許之，罷兵。

translations.literal: Zhongshan offered four cities for peace. The Wang permitted it and stopped the troops.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，攻中山。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, he attacked Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，惠后卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Hui Hou died.

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, he again attacked Zhongshan and seized lands north to Yan and Dai, west to Yun Zhong and Jiu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 二十七年五月戊申，大朝於東宮，傳國，立王子何以為王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, fifth month, Wu Shen, great court at the east palace, transmitted the state, and established Prince Zi He as Wang.

sentences.zh: 王廟見禮畢，出臨朝。

translations.literal: The Wang had temple audience, rites finished, and went out to attend court.

sentences.zh: 大夫悉為臣，肥義為相國，并傅王。

translations.literal: All grandees became ministers. Fei Yi became chancellor and together instructed the Wang.

sentences.zh: 是為惠文王。

translations.literal: This was Hui Wen Wang.

sentences.zh: 惠文王，惠后吳娃子也。

translations.literal: Hui Wen Wang was Hui Hou Wu Wa's son.

sentences.zh: 武靈王自號為主父。

translations.literal: Wu Ling Wang self-called himself Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 主父欲令子主治國，而身胡服將士大夫西北略胡地，而欲從雲中、九原直南襲秦，於是詐自為使者入秦。

translations.literal: Lord Father desired to make his son mainly govern the country, but himself, Hu clothed, led the scholar officials to raid Hu lands northwest, and desired to attack Qin straight south from Yun Zhong and Jiu Yuan. Thereupon he deceived himself as an envoy and entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王不知，已而怪其狀甚偉，非人臣之度，使人逐之，而主父馳已脫關矣。

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang did not know. Afterwards he was strange at his very great appearance, not a minister's measure. He sent people to pursue him, but Lord Father had already galloped and escaped the pass.

sentences.zh: 審問之，乃主父也。

translations.literal: He carefully questioned it and it was Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 秦人大驚。

translations.literal: The Qin people were greatly startled.

sentences.zh: 主父所以入秦者，欲自略地形，因觀秦王之為人也。

translations.literal: The reason Lord Father entered Qin was that he desired to survey the terrain himself, and thus observe Qin Wang's character.

sentences.zh: 惠文王二年，主父行新地，遂出代，西遇樓煩王於西河而致其兵。

translations.literal: In Hui Wen Wang's second year, Lord Father traveled the new lands, then went out to Dai, west met Lou Fan Wang at Xi He and brought their troops.

sentences.zh: 起靈壽，北地方從，代道大通。

translations.literal: He raised Ling Shou. The northern lands followed. Dai roads were greatly open.

sentences.zh: 還歸，行賞，大赦，置酒酺五日，封長子章為代安陽君。

translations.literal: He returned home, gave rewards, granted great amnesty, placed wine feasts for five days, and enfeoffed eldest son Zhang as Dai An Yang Jun.

sentences.zh: 章素侈，心不服其弟所立。

translations.literal: Zhang was always extravagant. His heart did not submit to his younger brother's establishment.

sentences.zh: 主父又使田不禮相章也。

translations.literal: Lord Father moreover sent Tian Bu Li to assist Zhang.

sentences.zh: 李兌謂肥義曰：「公子章彊壯而志驕，黨眾而欲大，殆有私乎？

translations.literal: Li Dui told Fei Yi said: 'Prince Zhang strong robust will arrogant, faction numerous desires great, perhaps has private?
translations.idiomatic: Li Dui told Fei Yi: 'Prince Zhang is strong and robust but his will is arrogant. His faction is numerous and his desires are great. Perhaps he has private ambitions?

sentences.zh: 田不禮之為人也，忍殺而驕。

translations.literal: Tian Bu Li's character endures killing and is arrogant.

translations.literal: The two people are mutually agreeable. They certainly have plotted secret villainy to arise, once using their bodies to seek fortune.

translations.literal: Indeed small people have desires. Their considerations are light and plots shallow. They only see benefits and do not regard harms. Those of the same kind mutually push each other. They together enter the calamity gate.

translations.idiomatic: Xin Qi said: 'Good! I obtained to hear this!'

translations.literal: Lord Father commanded the Wang to listen to court, but himself observed and spied on the group of ministers' clan chambers' rites from the side.

translations.literal: Lord Father and the Wang toured Sha Qiu in separate palaces. Prince Zhang immediately, with his followers and Tian Bu Li, made rebellion and deceived by using Lord Father's command to summon the Wang.

sentences.zh: 肥義先入，殺之。

translations.literal: Fei Yi entered first and killed him.

sentences.zh: 高信即與王戰。

translations.literal: Gao Xin immediately fought with the Wang.

translations.literal: Prince Cheng and Li Dui arrived from the country. They then raised troops from four cities and entered to resist the difficulty. They killed Prince Zhang and Tian Bu Li, extinguished their faction of traitors, and stabilized the wang chamber.

translations.literal: Prince Cheng became chancellor and was titled An Ping Jun. Li Dui became chief judge.

translations.literal: Prince Zhang's defeat caused him to go and flee to Lord Father. Lord Father opened the gate for him. Cheng and Dui thus surrounded Lord Father's palace.

sentences.zh: 公子章死，公子成、李兌謀曰：「以章故圍主父，即解兵，吾屬夷矣。」

translations.literal: Prince Zhang died, prince Cheng, Li Dui plotted said: 'Because Zhang surrounded Lord Father, immediately disband troops, we group exterminated.'
translations.idiomatic: Prince Zhang died. Prince Cheng and Li Dui plotted, saying: 'Because of Zhang, we surrounded Lord Father. If we immediately disband the troops, our group will be exterminated.'

sentences.zh: 乃遂圍主父。

translations.literal: They then thus surrounded Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 令宮中人「後出者夷」，宮中人悉出。

translations.literal: Commanded palace people 'later exit destroy family', palace people all exited.
translations.idiomatic: They commanded the palace people: 'Those who exit later will have their families destroyed.' The palace people all exited.

sentences.zh: 主父欲出不得，又不得食，探爵鷇而食之，三月餘而餓死沙丘宮。

translations.literal: Lord Father desired to exit but was not able. He moreover could not obtain food. He groped for wine cups and sparrows and ate them. After three months remaining, he starved to death in the Sha Qiu palace.

sentences.zh: 主父定死，乃發喪赴諸侯。

translations.literal: Lord Father certainly died. They then issued mourning and hastened to the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 是時王少，成、兌專政，畏誅，故圍主父。

translations.literal: At this time the Wang was young. Cheng and Dui monopolized governance. They feared execution, therefore they surrounded Lord Father.

translations.literal: Lord Father initially made eldest son Zhang the crown prince. Later he obtained Wu Wa and loved her. For several years he did not exit, and she gave birth to son He. He then deposed Crown Prince Zhang and established He as Wang.

translations.idiomatic: (Lord Father died and Hui Wen Wang was established) In the fifth year, with Yan's Dan and Yi.

translations.literal: In the eighth year, they walled south Xing Tang.

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Zhao Liang was general. With Qi they combined army and attacked Han, reaching below Lu Guan.

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Qin self-established as Western Di.

sentences.zh: 與秦會中陽。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin again with Zhao several times attacked Qi. The Qi people were troubled by it.

translations.idiomatic: Su Li for Qi sent a letter to Zhao Wang that said:

translations.literal: The minister has heard that ancient worthy lords' virtue and conduct were not spread within the seas, their teachings and compliance were not permeated among the people, their sacrifices and seasonal offerings were not frequent and constant among ghosts and spirits.

translations.literal: Sweet dew descended, timely rain arrived, the year's grains were abundant and ripe, the people had no diseases or epidemics, the crowd praised it. However, worthy lords planned it.
